## getValueFromPath() function

Gets the value at `path` of `object`<!-- -->. If the resolved value is `undefined`<!-- -->, the `defaultValue` is returned in its place.

 3.1.0  Object

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
declare function getValueFromPath<T, U extends object>(object: U, path: Array<T> | string, defaultValue?: unknown): any;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  object | U | The object to query. |
|  path | Array&lt;T&gt; \| string | The path of the property to get. |
|  defaultValue | unknown | The value returned for <code>undefined</code> resolved values. |

<b>Returns:</b>

any

{<!-- -->\*<!-- -->} Returns the resolved value.

## Example

const object = { 'a': \[{ 'b': { 'c': 3 } }<!-- -->\] }

getValueFromPath(object, 'a\[0\].b.c') // =<!-- -->&gt; 3

getValueFromPath(object, \['a', '0', 'b', 'c'\]) // =<!-- -->&gt; 3

getValueFromPath(object, 'a.b.c', 'default') // =<!-- -->&gt; 'default'
